## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r begin to read}
bigram_count <- read.csv(file = "/Users/mutecypher/Documents/Documents - Michael’s iMac/Coursera/Capstone Project/processed/bigram_count.csv" )
bigram_count <- bigram_count[,2:3]
bi_bigrams <- separate(bigram_count, bigram, c("word1", "word2"), sep = " ")
rm(bigram_count)
write.csv(bi_bigrams,file = "/Users/mutecypher/Documents/Documents - Michael’s iMac/Coursera/Capstone Project/processed/bi_bigrams.csv" )
rm(bi_bigrams)
```

## Get the n-1 grams

Make it go

```{r n-1 grams, echo=FALSE}

tri_trigrams <- tri_trigrams[,2:5]
tri_trigrams <- data.table(tri_trigrams)
```
